channel.title: World
channel.description: The Washington Post World section provides information and analysis of breaking world news stories. In addition to our world news and video, Post World News offers discussions and blogs on major international news and economic issues.

item.title: Trump win complicates Biden’s lame-duck foreign policy
item.dc:creator: Karen DeYoung, Michael Birnbaum, Missy Ryan
item.description: From Ukraine to Gaza, Trump’s unilateral and unpredictable tendencies could embolden both allies and enemies.

item.title: Trump win leaves Russia jubilant and Europe putting on a brave face
item.dc:creator: Washington Post staff
item.description: Israel’s and Ukraine’s leaders were among the first to congratulate Donald Trump. His victory is resonating across the globe.

item.title: U.S. vote was peaceful, but Trump’s fraud claims hurt trust, international observers say
item.dc:creator: Kelsey Baker
item.description: International monitors saw “a well-run process” in Tuesday’s U.S. election, but warned of “intolerant language against women and immigrants by one candidate.”

item.title: Ukrainian congratulations do little to mask fears about Trump presidency
item.dc:creator: David Stern, Serhiy Morgunov
item.description: Trump has expressed misgivings about continuing to support Ukraine in its war with Russia. Ukrainian officials recognize they need to win him over.

item.title: Trump’s win places immediate focus on immigration enforcement
item.dc:creator: Nick Miroff, Maria Sacchetti
item.description: Trump’s victory sets the stage for a turn in immigration policy that could upend the lives of millions of immigrants and recast the U.S. economy and labor force.

item.title: German governing coalition collapses, adding upheaval in uncertain moment
item.dc:creator: Kate Brady
item.description: Chancellor Olaf Scholz fired his finance minister and announced a confidence vote that is widely expected to fail and pave the way to early elections in the spring.

item.title: In Trump victory, Netanyahu sees himself as ‘the great winner’
item.dc:creator: Shira Rubin, Miriam Berger, Claire Parker
item.description: Across Israel, a country battered by its longest-ever war and roiled by internal crises, many breathed a sigh of relief after Trump’s sweeping triumph.

item.title: The U.S. has never been led by a woman. See how many countries have been.
item.dc:creator: Sammy Westfall, Dylan Moriarty
item.description: The U.S. has still not been led by a woman — a state increasingly rare in the world. Enter your birthday to find out the number of women who have served as president or prime minister around the world.

item.title: Right-wing populists cheer the return of Trump, one of their own
item.dc:creator: Anthony Faiola, Kate Brady
item.description: Populist leaders around the world said Donald Trump’s election victory was an endorsement of their stance on immigration, on climate and in the culture wars.

item.title: Israel Katz, new Israeli defense minister, is longtime Netanyahu ally
item.dc:creator: Loveday Morris
item.description: Analysts describe Katz as a yes-man who will give Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu more freedom on the battlefield and help ensure his own political survival.

item.title: Ukraine says forces clash with North Korean troops for first time
item.dc:creator: David Stern, Serhiy Morgunov
item.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky implored his Western allies to take action over Russia’s use of North Korean troops in the war.

item.title: What Trump’s win means for the world’s most pressing problems
item.dc:creator: Annabelle Timsit, Adela Suliman, Kelsey Ables
item.description: Republican Donald Trump will face immediate challenges as the Israel-Gaza and Russia-Ukraine wars rage. What his election means for NATO, aid, trade and more.

item.title: Lebanese first responders say they are being targeted by Israeli strikes
item.dc:creator: Louisa Loveluck, Mohamad El Chamaa, Suzan Haidamous
item.description: At least 178 Lebanese emergency workers have been killed in Israeli attacks since last October. Three-quarters of the deaths have occurred in the past six weeks.

item.title: What this U.S. election showed the world about America
item.dc:creator: Ishaan Tharoor
item.description: Harris and her allies cast Trump as unprecedented, fascistic threat. Trump, meanwhile, stewed in the same angry ultranationalism that powered his earlier presidential bids.

item.title: Netanyahu fires Defense Minister Yoav Gallant, prompting protest in Tel Aviv
item.dc:creator: Kelsey Ables, Victoria Bisset, Bryan Pietsch, Sammy Westfall, Kelsey Baker, Lior Soroka
item.description: Yoav Gallant had emerged as one of Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s fiercest and most public critics over his approach to the war in Gaza and the failure to reach a hostage deal with Hamas.

item.title: Netanyahu ousts defense minister, a political rival and fierce war critic
item.dc:creator: Shira Rubin, Lior Soroka
item.description: Yoav Gallant clashed with Netanyahu over his handling of the war in Gaza and, more recently, over the enlistment of the ultra-Orthodox in the Israeli military.

item.title: How the U.S. election process differs from others around the world
item.dc:creator: Amanda Coletta
item.description: The decentralized system of election management in the United States has few parallels. But results in many countries can take time to finalize.

item.title: Video: Defense minister’s dismissal prompts protests in Tel Aviv
item.dc:creator: Washington Post staff

item.title: Strikes continue in northern Gaza, killing dozens
item.dc:creator: Sammy Westfall

item.title: Netanyahu says ‘crisis of confidence’ led to Gallant’s ouster
item.dc:creator: Bryan Pietsch

item.title: As Middle East crisis grinds on, Pentagon shows signs of strain
item.dc:creator: Dan Lamothe, Abigail Hauslohner
item.description: For the first time since the Gaza war began, the U.S. will have no aircraft carrier nearby. Meanwhile, a weapons shortage has left the Pentagon spread thin.

item.title: Why Yoav Gallant was fired, according to Gallant himself
item.dc:creator: Sammy Westfall, Lior Soroka

item.title: Why Netanyahu fired his defense minister
item.dc:creator: Bryan Pietsch

item.title: The White House said it would “continue to work collaboratively” with the next Israeli defense minister...
item.dc:creator: Mikhail Klimentov

item.title: “For the past month, North Gaza has been under a near-total brutal siege. Civilians are starving...
item.dc:creator: Bryan Pietsch

item.title: Netanyahu ally accused of leaking documents to derail hostage deal
item.dc:creator: Adam Taylor, Lior Soroka
item.description: A former aide to the Israeli prime minister allegedly leaked top-secret military documents to foreign outlets to discredit a possible hostage agreement with Hamas.

item.title: Benny Gantz, an Israeli lawmaker and frequent critic of Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, said the...
item.dc:creator: Bryan Pietsch

item.title: Yoav Gallant, following the announcement that he was fired from his post as defense minister, said...
item.dc:creator: Bryan Pietsch

item.title: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu announced Tuesday he has fired Defense Minister Yoav Gallant. He said...
item.dc:creator: Bryan Pietsch

item.title: Putin makes Ukraine war veteran a governor as military gains prestige
item.dc:creator: Mary Ilyushina
item.description: The “Time of Heroes” program to promote veterans from the Ukraine war is part of the Kremlin’s effort to make military service more attractive.

item.title: At least 43,391 people have been killed in Gaza during the war and 102,347 injured, according...
item.dc:creator: Bryan Pietsch

item.title: The world is trying to make sense of the U.S. electoral college
item.dc:creator: Bryan Pietsch
item.description: The United States has a distinctive system for electing presidents indirectly — a source of confusion for those following the Trump-Harris race internationally.

item.title: Israelis and Palestinians find little hope in divisive U.S. election
item.dc:creator: Adam Taylor, Claire Parker, Hajar Harb

item.title: Brazilian police say they’ve solved the murder of former Post contributor
item.dc:creator: Terrence McCoy
item.description: Authorities have concluded that the killings of British journalist Dom Phillips and Indigenous rights activist Bruno Pereira were an act of retaliation targeting Pereira.

item.title: Israeli strikes in eastern Lebanon are hitting civilians without warning
item.dc:creator: Abbie Cheeseman

item.title: Israel’s actions on Gaza aid ‘not good enough,’ State Department says
item.dc:creator: Kelsey Ables

item.title: Israeli forces used civilians as human shields in Gaza, Palestinians and soldiers say
item.dc:creator: Louisa Loveluck, Hajar Harb, John Hudson

item.title: Diver finds and returns graduation ring lost for decades in the ocean
item.dc:creator: Daniel Wu
item.description: Alex Davis used a metal detector to find a lost graduation ring buried in Barbados. He returned it to its owner in Canada just before the man’s 83rd birthday.

item.title: Player dies after being struck by lightning during soccer match in Peru
item.dc:creator: Des Bieler
item.description: Teams in a local tournament in the Andean highlands east of Lima were leaving the pitch amid a weather delay when lightning struck, injuring several other players.

item.title: Israel ends agreement with U.N. agency for Palestinians
item.dc:creator: Miriam Berger, Leo Sands, Rachel Pannett, Sammy Westfall
item.description: Israel said it has withdrawn from the 1967 deal legally recognizing UNRWA. The Knesset has passed legislation curbing the U.N. agency’s activities and privileges.
